sections.title: sketch
sections.description: Sketching enables one to contextualize problems from a 20,000 feet view to minutiae details. It helps to gain perspectives over a broader scope to seek effective solutions. Over here, I understand business problems through inquiry and sketching its various components. This entails identifying and nurturing ideas; and then converging on a central concept and build further.

sections.title: design
sections.description: The sketching phase helps to map out prototypes. As details are etched out for user flow, new insights come into the fore that restrict user decision-making to achieve objectives. These are resolved in this phase.

sections.title: build
sections.description: I use ReactJS and NextJS to design the front-end. I focus on fuctionality to achieve user objective before implementing visual design elements. At the end of this, I hand you a fully functional front-end with APIs that is optimized for web performance.

liveProjects.title: HandForHandmade
liveProjects.description: Designed concepts, UI and Front-End for a pan-India discovery platform which brings artisans, designers and various organizations to enable business collaborations to sustain artisan livelihood

section.subheader: Created constraints for focus and creativity
section.description: After an initial discussion, a rough layout was sketched out and a low-fidelity prototype was developed for user flows on Figma, a sketching tool. Visuals and low details provided context for brainstorming; and being critical of adding features.

The color schemes were developed based on the logo color and its contrast colors with various hues.  The different hues of the logo and contrast colors were combined and shown to the client to choose from.
The app would have a regular site visitor; a registered user; and a member user. For each user category - unless a member user, information access restrictions were placed.

The members were categorized as individuals and non-individuals. In addition, there were numerous classifications within these categories. For each classification, information requirements varied and accordingly forms were programmed to capture the required data.

Given this app needs to support people living in rural areas, where they are resource constrained. Images with high-resolution are data heavy that could consume all their data. In order to empathize with such users white sending or receiving data, images uploads were compressed to about 90% of their original size while maintaining quality.
When a payment gateway could not be implemented due to certain challenges, a plan B was quickly devised and implemented. The app streamlined to complement the offline payment process.

demoProjects.title: NetflixClone
demoProjects.description: Developed a responsive app using ReactJS, Google Firebase and Stripe payment gateway

section.description: Understood data flow to design application architecture, which is an iterative process, with reusable components.In addition, SASS was integreated to make efficient design changes for components

section.subheader: Implemented NoSQL database using Google Firestore and Stripe payments integration
section.description: On a user signing up, their data was stored on a firestore database. The products, pricing and subscriptions plans served to the user were developed on Stripe. A webhook was implemented, that synchronized changes to firestore from Stripe, when a user subscribed to a product and made payment in Stripe. As a result, all latest information regarding a user's subscription were availabe at one place i.e. firestore database.
In order to fetch movie data and facilitate payments, the movieDB and Stripe API were used.
